channel.title: Release on Becoming a better Tester!
channel.description: Recent content in Release on Becoming a better Tester!

item.title: Releasing a build that has defects!...
item.description: Sounds weird right?! QA signing off on known defects for a release! Should it happen? If yes, when? If no, what might happen? This is quite a frequent scenario in these days of quick releases, early-to-market approaches. Also, keeping the QA position aside, one needs to understand that it is impossible to create and release new software that works 100% of the time. Finding a defect in Production by the customer is expected, and we - as in the project team / client - already have a process around on how to deal with it.
